body.p:
Frankfort December 18th 1865
To His Excellency
Gov Bramlette

George Ashton a prisoner in the Kentucky Penitentiary sentenced to two years confinement for theft by the Todd County Circuit Court, is laboring under a severe and painful gun shot wound The ball entered the back, ranged upwards into the lung, and has now been extracted The wound is of such character as totally to unift him for any labor whatever, and if he should recover at all, of which there is little probability, it would be a great length of time His health is failing and the ends of Justice cannot be by retaining him longer in confinenent

J. L. Phythian
surgeon Ky Penitentiary
I have examined the prisoner George Ashton referred to above, and concur fully with Dr Phythian in his opinion of the case.

J. M. Mills, M.D.
Inspector Ky Penitentiary
This young man may be a useful Citizen if he is released from Prison if he remains in Prison will come out an accomplished rascal --

Todd Cir Ct
vs
Geo Atchison
2 years
Pardoned 18 Dec 1865
